review_blob:
Not a bad little Pale Ale. Nice overall flavor from a solid Austin brewing company. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The old stand-by. This continues to be the most widely available craft beer that suits my palate. Here's to you, ye fine and splendorous ale of pale coloration. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I'm not a big wheat drinker (unless I'm in Germany) mainly due to wheat beer burnout in my formative drinking years. That being said, I really dug this beer-- a wheat foundation with some complex lemon, ginger, and honey notes that makes this a crisp and interesting drink. Note: this was listed as #42 on the label.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

New Mexico's craft brewing scene has been on the rise as of late-- in Santa Fe specifically. Marble Brewing might make a better IPA (add Second Street's IPA 1000 to the mix as well) but Santa Fe Brewing Co has distribution that reaches into Texas-- so I'm happy to have a Happy Camper any day of the week. Solid beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
